title: AP® Precalculus: Functions and Video Game Sales
driving_question: How can we use functions to solve real-world problems and predict trends?
short_background_context: In this mission, you will be exploring two distinct problems. The first problem involves the analysis of two functions, f and g, their properties, and their interactions. You will be asked to find specific values, determine end behavior, and explore the concept of inverse functions. The second problem is a real-world scenario involving the sales of a new video game. You will be asked to create a model to represent the sales, find the average rate of change, estimate sales for a specific day, and explain the limitations of the model.
tasks: Analyze the functions f and g, find specific values, and determine the end behavior of g.
Determine if f has an inverse function and explain your reasoning.
Create a model for the video game sales, find the average rate of change, estimate sales for a specific day, and explain the limitations of the model.
pre_thinking_prompts: What do you know about functions and their properties?
What is an inverse function and how can you determine if a function has an inverse?
How can you create a model to represent a real-world scenario?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on your understanding of functions and their properties. How did this mission help you better understand the application of functions in real-world scenarios?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain your reasoning for your answer?
How did you determine the end behavior of the function g?
What factors did you consider when creating the model for the video game sales?
remix_zone: Consider a different real-world scenario. How would you create a model to represent this scenario? What factors would you need to consider?
